title: How to Know What to Do in Poor Photography Situations

steps.headline: Make sure you are prepared.
steps.description: Don't just take the lens you are going to use. Bring at least 2 or 3 if you can. Give yourself some options.

steps.headline: Don't get tunnel vision.
steps.description: Just because you expected to take pictures of people at the fair, doesn't mean you can't take pictures. Relax and look around.

steps.headline: Give yourself time to feel the disappointment that you will undoubtedly feel.
steps.description: You are human after all. Sit down, take a breath, look around.

steps.headline: Change your perspective.
steps.description: Get on your knees, get dirty, and take some pictures.

steps.headline: Get creative.
steps.description: That is why you chose photography. That is your ideal medium. Now use it and look photographically.

steps.headline: Walk around.
steps.description: Take advantage of being in a (presumably) different location and look around. You just might find your next awesome photo op!

steps.headline: Consider taking photos of strangers.
steps.description: You would be amazed at how many would love to mug for the camera!

steps.headline: Step outside of your photography box.
steps.description: Do something different. That goes along with getting creative.
